description: Probably a derivative of Middle English sissen (“to hiss; buzz; hum”), equivalent to siss +‎ -le (frequentative suffix).

entries.meaning: (countable) The sound of water boiling on a hot surface.
examples: We heard the sizzle of the onions hitting the pan.

entries.meaning: (countable, informal) The process of being cooked which involves that sound.
examples: Give them a sizzle for a few more minutes before serving.
Her performance had a lot of sizzle.

verbs.description: sizzle (third-person singular simple present sizzles, present participle sizzling, simple past and past participle sizzled)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To make the sound of water boiling on a hot surface.
examples: The sausages were sizzling on the barbecue.

entries.meaning: (transitive, informal) To cook (something) in a manner which causes that sound.
examples: I sizzled the bacon for a few minutes in the pan.
